items: Scrum master
Product Owner
Developers
After the Sprint Review and before the next Sprint Planning session
3 hours max (for shorter Sprints the full 3 hours may not be necessary)
Time to reflect on what was created and how it was created
Review the Definition of Ready and the Definition of Done
Identify what went well and improvements to make the next Sprint more effective and efficient
Scrum Master ensures that the meeting takes place in the timebox and encourages the team to improve
Is a business objective set during planning to provide focus
The commitment to the Sprint Backlog
Can be formed either bottom up or top down
Goals are SMART (Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant and Time Limited)
The commitment to the increment
When the Sprint comes to an end the product should be in a ‘Done’ state as defined by the DoD
Is agreed up-front to ensure all work required is included in the estimates
The ‘Done’ increment should be potentially releasable and is integrated with previous increments
A working agreement between the team and Product Owner on what readiness means
Ensures stories proposed for the Sprint have enough detail
A backlog item is only ‘Ready’ if it’s clear and if all team members have a shared understanding of what it means
Not having a clearly defined DoR can lead to rework or waste
